bwwExcerpt: That joyful noise you hear arising from the Samuel J. Friedman Theatre is the mellifluous tenor of Jeremy Pope, the golden-voiced actor making his Broadway debut in Tarell Alvin McCraney's tender coming-of-age drama Choir Boy. You might remember Pope from Choir Boy's 2013 off-Broadway premiere at Manhattan Theatre Club's City Center Stage II; thankfully, he's returned-along with a few other original cast members, including amiable Tony-winner Chuck Cooper (as a no-nonsense headmaster) and a wond
